title.narrative: Good Governance and Human Rights Programme in Ghana, phase II (2009-2013)

description.narrative:
The second phase of good governance- and human rights (GGHRP II) is a five-year programme spanning from 2009 to 2013 with a budget of DKK 170 million kroner.
The programme has the objective of improving the Ghanaian citizen¿s opportunities to ensure the protection of their human rights, and to enhance citizen¿s opportunities to participate in societal affairs. Three different kinds of support are given: support for the courts and human rights institution, civil society and the media.
The programme is divided into two components. In the first component, which has the objective of increasing capacity in the most important independent legal- and rights institutions, the support is given to the Commission for Human Rights and Administrative Justice, and the courts. The second component aims at strengthening the demands for good governance and human rights by supporting civil society and the media. The support is given via a common support fund called STAR Ghana, which is an abbreviation of Strengthening Transparency, Accountability and Responsiveness (STAR) Ghana. The initiative is supported by the UK through DfiD, the European Union (EU), USAID and DANIDA.
